title: Superatec & Citi Certify Young People from Low-Income Neighborhoods in Financial Education
summary: Caracas - Superatec certified its first cohort in 2017, a group of 200 young people who completed the financial education program the organization brings to low-income communities in Venezuela with sponsorship from the Citi Foundation.
tag-1: Superatec & Citi Certify Young People from Low-Income Neighborhoods in Financial Education
tag-2: Caracas – Superatec certified its first cohort in 2017, a group of 200 young people who completed the financial education program the organization brings to low-income communities in Venezuela with sponsorship from the Citi Foundation.
tag-3: The program, offered for the last six years at all Superatec centers, offers young people simple and practical tips for managing their personal finances. Among the topics covered are savings, budgets, small business fundamentals, bank accounts and credit options. The goal of the program is to supply participants with the tools they need to be better prepared to enter the formal sector, continue their vocational or college studies, start a business, or simply pursue their goals for self-improvement.
tag-4: Participants from the Superatec center in Petare received their certificates in a ceremony at Citibank's headquarters in Caracas on April 25. Citi Country Officer Diana Torres and the President of Superatec, Zandra Pedraza, presided over the moving ceremony, expressing their hope of a better future for the country's young people.
tag-5: One of the certificate recipients, Luzjeidis Velasquez, took advantage of the opportunity to thank Superatec and Citi for the opportunity to participate in the program. "Self-improvement is key," she said, exhorting her fellows to continue their efforts to better themselves to achieve their life goals.
tag-6: More than 5,000 young people of both sexes have graduated from the Citi/Superatec financial education program since 2011, drawn from low-income communities in the greater Caracas area and eight Venezuelan states. Including their immediate families, more than 20,000 people are estimated to have benefited indirectly from the program.
tag-7: Superatec offers young people who complete a minimum of 40 hours of training the opportunity to register with its Job Bank, which recruits applicants for openings at partner businesses and companies.
tag-8: The initiative is part of the Citi Foundation's Pathways to Progress, a global effort to prepare young people for a career and help them access the opportunities they need to succeed in the current economy. Pathways to Progress is comprised of programs, research and associations that help young people develop an entrepreneurial mentality, acquire leadership, financial and workplace skills, and find their first jobs in the formal sector.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
